name: Fractured School Supplies Quiz | Fractured Schooldays | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
eraser.

	Today they come in a myriad of shapes and colors, but I prefer the good old Pink Pearl erasers.

pair of scissors.

	Elementary school scissors are snub-nosed.

pens and pencils.

	My favorite pencils are Extra Soft Dixon Ticonderogas. However, they smear quite a lot. I used to like cartridge pens, but now I like roller ball ones.

bookcovers & book covers.

	In my day, we were required to cover all of our textbooks with paper covers.

questions.correct: loose-leaf notebook & loose leaf notebook & looseleaf notebook
questions.explanation:
loose-leaf notebook & loose leaf notebook & looseleaf notebook.

	These are also called ring binders.

protractor.

	These are usually plastic half circles with angle measures marked on them. You use them in geometry class.

textbooks.

	I write K-12 textbooks to make a living. (I know, everyone hates them, but I do my best to write lively, interesting, well-researched ones.)

questions.text: He licked chronic caulk you later?
questions.explanation:
electronic calculator.

	These days it's permissible to use this handy tool to solve math problems.

questions.text: Sent him mead her roux lore?
questions.explanation:
centimeter ruler & centimetre ruler.

	Many rulers have inches on one side and centimeters on the other.

glue stick & gluestick.

	These are much less messy than library paste (which kids used to eat) or white glue.
